I think I've contracted brown rot...
Word of an Epidemic

We have received news of an epidemic in [plague_outbreak_location.Realm.GetName]. The information is vague, but word is people are dying like flies and the fear of the disease is spreading as fast as the affliction itself. Furthermore, the condition is reported irreversible as well as incurable, and the scattered records of the events are worrisome. With no source of evil revealed people are turning to their gods and on each other, to protect themselves from contagion. Many call it similar to the Flu, but far worse...

We have received news of a horrible epidemic in [plague_outbreak_location.GetName], part of [plague_outbreak_location.Realm.GetName]. At first the rumors were thought to be exaggerated, but ever since the disorderly arrival of inconsolable refugees at our gates, it has been difficult to ignore what is happening. They tell of various symptoms, and our couriers from the area report seeing people covered head to toe in a single red rash, coughing endlessly, while others have blood ooze from the eyes, nose and mouth. Terror is spreading as rapidly as the disease and so far there has been no mention of a cure... Only mass graves. Is this the will of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]?

Our people in [plague_outbreak_location.GetName] are suffering from a frightening epidemic. Those afflicted by the disease display bright red rashes all over their bodies and high fever before losing blood from their eyes, noses and mouths and dying, some in the middle of the streets, healthy only a few days earlier. Dread is spreading, seeping into the heart of the realm while our healers are at a loss - there is no cure to the horror wreaking havoc among the populace. The cause of the disease is unknown and those trying to protect themselves are left to their own devices. Bodies are piling up, a mix bright red from the rashes and dark red from dried blood... Knahaten Flu is at our doorstep.

Mobs of new people are arriving in [bordering_province.GetName]. Most of the newly arrived are commoners fleeing the Knahaten Flu that has reached [infected_province.GetName] just beyond the borders of our realm. Some have lost their whole families, some are trying to protect theirs and a few are travelers or merchants that had an easier time moving. All of them seem to have witnessed indescribable horrors, hardly any will talk about it at all. The ones that do talk, warn others of the coming epidemic and urge them stay inside or pack their things and flee.
We must survive this.

Knahaten Flu has spread throughout Argonia, annihilating the entire region's non-Argonian populace. Man, Mer and Beast alike are dying by the thousands as their corpses collapse into the fetid swamps and waterways. The Argonians are scrambling to make sense of the death that surrounds them. Non-Argonian villages in the marshlands have become ghost towns, some bereft of even a single inhabitant.

Trade routes across Tamriel are suddenly losing much of their business, and the reason is known - word is coming in that Elsweyr and its great cities have been swept by the Knahaten Flu. As bloodied corpses fill the once-busy streets of the sprawling Khajiiti cities, horrified officials have turned to razing whole neighborhoods in an effort to stop the spread of disease.

An ominous shadow looms over Morrowind as Knahaten Flu has left little but tragedy in its wake. Even the largest of Morrowind's ancient Dunmer families are barely clinging to existence as casualties pile up. Worshippers of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] pack the temples, seeking healing and wondering why something so terrible would ever be allowed to happen.

Death is haunting Cyrodiil, the land of the Imperials. The densely-packed cities that were once considered beacons of civilization have transformed into death traps filled with rotting, diseased corpses. Lake Rumare, the Niben River and other waterways are clogged with barges full of refugees seeking to flee from the epidemic, and the roads are strewn with the forsaken belongings of panicked travellers.

Skyrim, a land famous for being home to the proud and hardy Nords, has given in to despair as the agonizing effects of Knahaten Flu spread throughout the region. The crisp mountain air, once perfumed by the beds of wildflowers, now reeks of the decaying corpses that line the roads and both the White River and the River Karth.

Death comes to all, and in High Rock, this has become all too true as the land plays host to the dreaded Knahaten Flu. Commoners and nobles alike are perishing in record numbers and the once-lucrative Iliac Bay is now the escape route of choice for hundreds of jam-packed refugee vessels. Even the greatest of the region's questing and crusading Breton heroes are at a loss for how to alleviate their people's suffering.

Panic is rising as Knahaten Flu destroys the lives of victims across Hammerfell. As the streets of its glimmering cities run red with blood, bands of terrified Redguards and other residents are retreating into hastily-planned camps in the mountains and desert sands, hoping to wait out the epidemic by avoiding its wrath. Time will tell if such plans will work, but reports are that even many of these camps are falling victim to Knahaten Flu.

Cries ring out in the forests of Valenwood. Knahaten Flu stalks beneath the canopy and creeps in the highest tree branches, like an inescapable predator with an insatiable appetite. No matter where the Bosmer, Imga and other tree-climbers flee, the ravages of Knahaten Flu follow, and the underbrush is stained from the blood of dead bodies.

Not even the isolationist ways of the Altmer could protect their islands - Knahaten Flu has reached the shores of Alinor and decimated the populace. Mages all over the islands are attempting to mitigate the Knahaten Flu's damage and save the ailing populace, but their efforts seem to be in vain as many are falling ill, themselves.

No one is safe as the Knahaten Flu claims victims in Pyandonea. Temples to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] are filled with writhing worshippers, many bleeding out from the disease as they cry out to overwhelmed priests in efforts to find healing. The rapid deaths of Maormer Snake-Mages has caused the Elves to lose control of their once-loyal sea serpents, many of which now stalk the jungles and waterways and prey on unwary refugees.

From the Meratsies River Valley all the way to the Topara Valley, Knahaten Flu terrorizes the people of Tsaesci. As blood flows from their eyes, noses and mouths, the blood-drinking Tsaesci believe their sources of nourishment to have been poisoned. Conspiracy theories run rampant and the butcher shops and kitchens that produce blood for public consumption have been torched, but it has been of little use in stopping the epidemic.

Even the wind-swept tundras of Kamal cannot stop the merciless march of the Knahaten Flu. Pockets of smoke can be seen rising over the horizon no matter which direction one faces - the tell-tale sign of countless funeral pyres constructed to destroy the rotting bodies of unfortunate victims. What little trade took place here has completely halted, as frightened survivors hide themselves in remote lodges and ice-covered strongholds.

The Thousand Monkey Islands, full of once-busy cities and formerly host to lively festivals, have fallen to panic and desperation. Seaside villages have shuttered their ports in vain hopes of slowing the spread of disease, leaving many Tang Mo city-dwellers trapped on islands where Knahaten Flu is destroying nearly everything it touches.

A deathly cloud hangs over the sandy homeland of the Po Tun. In spite of the talents of their finest healers and wizards, thousands of Po Tun residents have perished from Knahaten Flu. Their corpses, rapidly piling up in the streets, bake under the scorching desert sun. The resulting stench permeates every rock-hewn city and is driving refugees into the inhospitable deserts and badlands.

Knahaten Flu is mercilessly sweeping into the Quey Islands. Ships full of dead bodies idly drift into its bays and ports, greeting horrified townspeople with the promise of infection and almost certain doom. Quey Islanders can neither identify a reliable cause nor cure for the epidemic, and many have given up their seafaring lives and retreated inland to the forested hills where they believe exposure to the disease is less likely.

The cold hand of death, more frigid than even the most frozen reaches of Atmora itself, grips the Northern Continent. Whole villages of Atmorans have perished to Knahaten Flu, their bloody bodies quickly buried under the endless snowstorms. The largest settlements have turned to self-quarantine, with weeping men, women and children wandering out into the wilds to die, perishing by exposure to the elements in hopes of protecting their families from infection.

Roscrea's brisk air, once dominated by the smell of rendered whale carcasses, now stinks of the mounting casualties inflicted by Knahaten Flu. Whalers and fishers alike are taking to their boats, even tiny skiffs, and heading out to sea with the notion that they can wait out the epidemic. Those stuck on land are less fortunate, with the death toll rising sharply day by day.

Disaster strikes Yokuda, the Sunken Continent. Knahaten Flu has reached the shores of its many islands, and the formerly busy trade ports are at a standstill as panicking Yokudan merchants, sailors and townspeople crowd the many temples in desperate hopes of finding healing. The local priests, despite their best efforts, can do little to stem the tide of the Knahaten Flu.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] brought you a kettle of steaming-hot herbal tea and instructed you to drink at least five cups worth of the beverage every day to treat your cough.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recommended that to minimize the effects of diarrhea, you should eat plenty of fruit and freshly-baked bread.
To combat your fatigue, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] prescribed a diet rich in meat and flavorful, starchy-tasting foods.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] suggested that to make your headache go away, you should sleep in total darkness, drink plenty of water and avoid loud, poorly-played music.
In order to minimize your chest pains, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] said it would be best to minimize stress whenever possible, to not raise your voice and to minimize physical exertion.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] explained that to get rid of your rash, it would be wise to bathe twice everyday, taking care to never reuse a bar of soap. [FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] mentioned changing into freshly-laundered clothes everyday as well.
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] that that in order to minimize your abdominal pain, you should take care to eat a diet of soft, easy-to-digest foods until a week after the pain has subsided.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] brought you a glass of boiled water and had you drink it. "Every time you get thirsty or hungry," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] said, "You need to drink boiled water - and only boiled water. You should also drink a full glass every time you vomit."
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] advised you that you should exercise briskly for an hour each at dawn, before lunchtime and at dusk until your malaise has cleared.
As a remedy for your uncomfortable cramps, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] recommended that the affected areas receive massage treatments everyday until the discomfort ceased.

To reduce your fever, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] wrapped you in a warm woollen blanket and placed a cold, wet cloth on your forehead. [FromFrom.GetSheHe] informed a servant to replace the current cloth apply a new one, also damp with water, no less than once per hour.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] brought you a bowl of mushroom soup. "Here, make sure to eat all of this," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] said. "The mushrooms used in this recipe should help resist illness, likewise will the crushed pearl that I sprinkled into the broth."

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] drew a steaming hot bath and told you to climb into the tub. "Stay submerged from the neck down until all your toes and fingers have pruned," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] stated. "Bathe in this manner thrice daily until your symptoms have passed."

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] handed you a badly-worn, burnished silver amulet. "You may use this old Resist Disease amulet that I borrowed from a friend of mine," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] said. "If anyone asks about it, you didn't get it from me."

To alleviate your ailment, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] gave you a handful of hawk feathers and instructed you to chew one before and after each meal. "The raw feathers of a dead bird are among the best things for curing diseases," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] noted. "Ironic, isn't it?"

In order to treat your symptoms, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] brought you a freshly-baked pie. "It's an old local recipe," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] said. "Livestock herders out on long treks swear by it for preventing sickness."

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] provided you with a bowl of crab soup. "I'm sorry if the texture is unpleasant," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] groaned. "The chitin mixed into the broth works wonders, but I couldn't find any soft shell crab."
[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] said that to deal with your discomfort, you should get ample bed rest everyday. To that end, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] gave you an extra-comfy pillow to place under your head.

To reduce your symptoms, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] brought you a bubbling potion and instructed you to drink it. "This is a Potion of Resist Disease," [FromFrom.GetSheHe] elaborated. "It should work, but please inform me if you continue to feel unwell."

column6: ¡[recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] me servirá!

column4: Was könnte schon schiefgehen?

column6: Uno de tus exploradores informa de un peregrino que acaba de llegar a [Root.Capital.GetName]. column2: I will recruit this pilgrim!

column3: Un envoyé de la cité de [student_city_target.GetName] vous a parlé de [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName], un[recruited_physician_target.GetNoneE] jeune [recruited_physician_target.GetManWoman] ayant un don pour les arts médicinaux. column6: Un enviado de la ciudad de [student_city_target.GetName] ha llegado con noticias respecto a tu búsqueda de un médico. Coaccionar[recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] para que se una a tu corte sería una tarea fácil.

column2: Young but skilled, bring [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] to court!

column4: Jung aber talentiert, willkommen an meinem Hof!
column6: ¡Joven, pero experto/a, traed[recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] a la corte!

column2: Scouts bring word of a mystic blind [recruited_physician_target.GetManWoman] that supposedly works miracles! [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] appears around the villages and cures all manner of ailments afflicting the peasants. The peasants call [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstNameWithNick]. A gift of gold would convince [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] to come to your court.
column3: Des éclaireurs rapportent qu'un un[recruited_physician_target.GetNoneE] [recruited_physician_target.GetManWoman], mystique et aveugle, pourrait réaliser des miracles ! column4: Eure Kundschafter berichten von einem/einer Blinden, der/die wahre Wunder vollbringen soll! [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] zieht durch die Dörfer und heilt allerlei Gebrechen der Bauern. Es heißt sogar, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] hätte einen Lahmen wieder gehen lassen! Die Bauern nennen [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstNameWithNick], und mit einem Goldgeschenk würde [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] sich dazu überreden lassen, an Euren Hof zu kommen.
column6: ¡Los exploradores traen palabra de un/a [recruited_physician_target.GetManWoman] ciego/a místico que al parecer obra milagros! [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] aparece por las aldeas y cura toda clase de dolencias que afligen a los campesinos. ¡Incluso corren rumores de que [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] hizo que un cojo volviese a andar de nuevo! Los campesinos [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] llaman [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstNameWithNick]. Un regalo de oro [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] convencería a venir a tu corte.

column2: [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] will work miracles at my court!
column3: [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] fera des miracles à ma Cour !
column4: [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] wird Wunder an meinem Hof vollbringen!
column6: ¡Hará milagros en mi corte!

column2: Your messengers tell you of a mercenary band that just arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName]. Along with them is the field surgeon [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName], known for [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] ability to rapidly amputate limbs and save the lives of gravely wounded soldiers. Despite the reputation of mercenaries often being greedy, hiring [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] seems comparatively cheap!
column3: Vos messagers mentionnent une bande de mercenaires qui vient juste d'arriver à [Root.Capital.GetName]. Parmi eux se trouve un chirurgien de terrain, [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName], dont les capacités à amputer rapidement des membres et sauver les vies de soldats gravement blessés sont connues. Malgré la cupidité réputée des mercenaires, l'embaucher semblera comparativement bon marché !
column4: Eure Kundschafter berichten von einer Söldnertruppe, die gerade in [Root.Capital.GetName] eingetroffen ist. Darunter befindet sich auch [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName], eine Koryphäe der Feldchirurgie. [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHeCap] ist dafür bekannt, Körperteile in Windeseile amputieren und schwer verwundete Soldaten so vor dem sicheren Tod retten zu können. Söldner gelten zwar oft als gierig, doch [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName] an Euren Hof zu holen erscheint verhältnismäßig billig!
column6: Tus mensajeros te informan de una compañía mercenaria que acaba de llegar a [Root.Capital.GetName]. Junto con ellos está su médico de campaña, [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName], conocido por [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] capacidad para amputar miembros rápidamente y salvar las vidas de soldados gravemente heridos. ¡A pesar de la reputación de codicia de los mercenarios, contratar[recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] parece relativamente barato!

column2: Perfect, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] will serve me well!
column3: Parfait, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] me servira bien !
column4: Perfekt, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] wird mir gute Dienste leisten!
column6: ¡Perfecto, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] me servirá bien!

column2: One of your scouts report of a cunning eunuch who has taken up residence in a nearby tavern. The eunuch spends his time drinking wine, eating and sharing stories with the guests. Apparently he is very well-schooled and has vast knowledge of medicinal mixtures. An offer of gold and food would definitely convince him to take up residence at your court as physician!
column3: Un de vos éclaireurs rapporte qu'un eunuque futé s'est installé dans une taverne voisine. Il passe son temps à boire du vin, manger et échanger des histoires avec les convives. Apparemment il est très instruit et a beaucoup de connaissances sur les mixtures médicinales. Une offre d'or et de nourriture le convaincra de venir occuper le poste de physicien de votre Cour !
column4: Einer Eurer Kundschafter berichtet über einen gerissenen Eunuchen, der in einer nahegelegenen Taverne abgestiegen ist. Er trinkt Wein, isst viel und tauscht Erzählungen mit den anderen Gästen aus. Er soll sehr gebildet sein und über großes Wissen im Bereich medizinischer Tinkturen verfügen. Wenn Ihr ihm Gold und Speisen anbietet, könntet Ihr ihn zweifelsohne davon überzeugen, die Stelle des Hofarztes für Euch zu übernehmen!
column6: Uno de tus exploradores informa de un astuto eunuco astuto que se ha instalado en una taberna cercana. El eunuco pasa el tiempo bebiendo vino, comiendo y compartiendo historias con los huéspedes. Según parece, es instruido y tiene un extenso conocimiento de preparados medicinales. ¡Una oferta de oro y comida definitivamente lo convencería para establecerse en tu corte como médico!

column2: Load up a cart with cheese and wine!
column3: Chargez une charrette de fromage et de vin !
column4: Beladet einen Wagen mit Käse und Wein!
column6: ¡Cargad un carro hasta arriba de queso y vino!

column2: One of your messengers return with news of a strange [recruited_physician_target.GetManWoman] teaching students the ways of healing at [nun_temple_target.GetName]. Although the [recruited_physician_target.GetManWoman] is well-known among the locals for having some skills in healing, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] is infamous for using cold compresses to treat every malady imaginable. If you were to donate a tidy sum to [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] academy, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] would come work for you.
A remarkable person. I will make this donation!

Your rangers report of a suspected witch living in the outskirts of the realm. They have never been able to prove that the woman has malicious goals, although the villagers do not trust her. She is willing to put her medical mixology skills to good use in your court and offers to become your physician in exchange for naught but a Daedra's heart. A most strange offer.
The slimy heart of a Daedra? I see nothing wrong with that!

As you lie sleeping in the courtyard you are suddenly awakened by the sound of something colliding with the ground. As you look up, you see a frazzled Khajiit dusting [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim]self off, cursing under [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] breath. Suddenly, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] notices you and smiles. 'This one has traveled fast across the land to serve you,' the wanderer says. 'Khajiit has healing...if you have coin.'
Your whiskers are magnificent! Join me at my court!

Your scouts tell of an up-and-coming mage who just arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName]. The spellcaster, named [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName], is said to gather [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] materials on [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] own, always disappearing into the wilderness at night and returning days later with satchels full of reagents. For the right price, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] would be thrilled to find employment at your court.
Sounds promising! Talents in alchemy are invaluable.

You are told that a reclusive wanderer is passing through a nearby village. This [recruited_physician_target.GetManWoman] would have evaded notice if not for the fact that some farmers witnessed [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] mend the wounds of a poor pilgrim who was set upon by bandits...and then chase down and slay the bandits on [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] own! With a little bit of gold as incentive, we can coax this strange traveller out of the shadows and make [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] a fixture of your court.
A good candidate, pay [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] and bring [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] to court!
column3: Un bon candidat. Payez-[recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] et amenez-[recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] à la Cour !
column4: Ausgezeichnet, bezahlt [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] und bringt [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] an meinen Hof!
column6: Un buen candidato, ¡pagad[recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] and traed[recruited_physician_target.GetHerHim] a la corte!

column2: An extremely peculiar healer arrived in [Root.Capital.GetName]. Your guards report that [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] claims to be blessed by Clavicus Vile, receiving healing abilities beyond anyone's wildest dreams. [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] alleges to have absolutely no formal training as a healer, but would be thrilled to demonstrate what [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] says [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] traded away [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] life savings for.
Beyond -anyone-'s wildest dreams? This I have to see!

Rumors have begun circulating from local mages about a spellcaster exceptionally gifted in the arts of Restoration. There is, however, a catch. The healer, named [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName], is by all accounts a chicken! It is unknown when this transformation took place, and unknown if [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] will ever transform back into [recruited_physician_target.GetHerHis] true form! Until then, [recruited_physician_target.GetFirstName] can be coaxed to our court with a generous bag of poultry feed.
With such talent, [recruited_physician_target.GetSheHe] must be at the top of the pecking order!
[From.GetTitledName] has informed me that my recent ailment is in fact Brown Rot. [From.GetSheHeCap] was very sorry, but there is nothing [From.GetSheHe] can do.
Word is going around that since the epidemic came to [capital.GetName] we have seen an increase in cats. Our people are sure the cats are in fact Khajiit spies, who are helping spread the disease.
Gather some cats for interrogation.
Pay for some outside help to get cats delivered.\n
No, the cats are not spies!

[cat_examiner.GetFirstName] reports that the cats seemed completely unresponsive to [cat_examiner.GetHerHis] questions. Further examination to determine their intellect suggests that these are just ordinary house cats.
So the cats are not to blame. Let them go.
Keep some for observation.

Complaints about the cats will not end, and an angry mob has gathered claiming that some of the cats must be Khajiit agents, and that they have proof. One of the townspeople reveals a few pieces of moon sugar, which the mob claims was found in the same alley as one of the alleged spies.
Kill the 'source'.
You take the alleged 'spy' and execute it publicly.
These cats are just that. Ordinary cats.
You calm the mob down with a convincing speech.
Have any of you actually ever met a Khajiiti spy?
Try your best to explain the cat situation.
Get rid of these seditious felines!
This is absurd, go home.

[worried_courtier.GetFirstName] has gotten the news of my decision to remove all the cats. 'There is no way that these cats are spies, and I will not accept your decision!' [worried_courtier.GetSheHe] says.
I'm sorry [worried_courtier.GetFirstName], but they could be plotting our demise.
We can keep it a secret. But you owe me.
[worried_courtier.GetFirstName] should have taken care of hiding [worried_courtier.GetHerHis] feline friends. They have been spotted by others and now the people are furious this was kept secret.
Curse you [worried_courtier.GetFirstName]!
One of the examined cats seems to have taken a liking to you, a sweet meow whenever you pass by their cages and a soft purr whenever you come close.
I will call her 'Whiskers', my new sweetheart.
I will call her 'Mittens', my new sweetheart.
I will call her 'Boots', my new sweetheart.
The people would not approve.
[From.GetTitledName] has called for all cats to be executed as spies, as you enjoy your time with the cats around the court, this would be horribly upsetting.
I will ask for an exception.
I cannot argue with my liege.
[From.GetTitledName] refused to make an exception.
That [GetRootFromInsult]!
[From.GetTitledName] agreed to let me keep the cats, in exchange for a favor.
What a relief.

Your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [From.GetFirstName] has brought you some troubling news. Words are spreading that a coven of mages worshipping [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] are the root of the terrible epidemic ravaging your realm. [From.GetTitledFirstName] encourages you to look into these rumors.
Horrifying news indeed! Investigate this for me, [From.GetFirstName].

You send your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] to investigate the rumors about cultist mages.

All of your demesne gets §Y'Peasant Unrest'§! for 10 years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §R+10.0%§!
Local Tax Modifier: §R-50.0%§!
Nonsense! What a lousy excuse.

You dismiss the rumors and the concerns of [Root.GetLordSpiritualName].

All of your demesne gets §Y'Peasant Crisis'§! for 10 years, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §R+15.0%§!
Local Tax Modifier: §R-75.0%§!

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has brought you an alarming amount of people who claim to have witnessed strange lights and noises - the hallmarks of spells - emanating from caves. If you are to believe their accounts, the allies of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] are many and pose a great threat to your realm.
[FromFrom.GetFirstName], you must find these mages, before it is too late!
You send your [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] to find any cultist mages in your court.\n
Warn the court - everyone must stay vigilant!
Make sure that all of your courtiers are watching for signs of cultist mages.\n
Actually, I already have my suspicions...
Take the opportunity and denounce someone you dislike as belonging to a vile cult.\n
These stories are ridiculous. Stop wasting my time!
You dismiss the witnesses and the concerns of [Root.GetLordSpiritualName].\n

After a thorough investigation, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has come to the conclusion that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is most likely the cultist in your court. [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHeCap] has been seen talking to themselves in strange languages and a few poor souls have even been assaulted by [bg_likely_witch.GetHerHim].

After a thorough investigation, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has come to the conclusion that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is most likely the cultist in your court. Everyone knows [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] to be a most sinful [bg_likely_witch.GetManWoman] and as such [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] must be consorting with [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName].

After a thorough investigation, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has come to the conclusion that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is most likely the cultist in your court. [From.GetFirstName] claims to have found condemning scriptures in [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName]'s chambers, suggesting that [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] is not a true servant of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has brought you some distressing news - [From.GetSheHe] is certain that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is a cultist! [From.GetSheHeCap] claims to have seen [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] talking to [bg_likely_witch.GetHerselfHimself] in a strange tongue and also informs you of several incidents where [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] have assaulted other members of court.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] approaches you with a most serious accusation - [From.GetSheHe] believes that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is a cultist! [From.GetSheHeCap] says that everyone knows [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] to be a most sinful [bg_likely_witch.GetManWoman] and as such [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] must be consorting with [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName].

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has told you something quite unsettling. Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has reason to believe that [bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName] is a cultist! [From.GetSheHeCap] claims to have found condemning scriptures in [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName]'s chambers, suggesting that [bg_likely_witch.GetSheHe] is not a true servant of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
You must be right, [From.GetFirstName]! I will have [bg_likely_witch.GetHerHim] imprisoned!

§Y[bg_likely_witch.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
These accusations are preposterous! [bg_likely_witch.GetFirstName] is [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s faithful servant!
You dismiss the intelligence §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! gave you.\n

[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName] and [bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName] burst into your throne room, yelling madly. Apparently both have reasons to believe that the other belongs to an evil cult. While the accusations are dire, there is no physical proof. You only have your gut feeling to go on.
[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName] must be a cultist!
§Y[bg_rival_1.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.\n
There is only one cultist here and that is [bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName]!

§Y[bg_rival_2.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be imprisoned until it is time for judgment.

All of your demesne gets §Y'Peasants Pleased With Witch Hunt'§! for 60 days, giving the following effects:
Local Revolt Risk: §G-10.0%§!
I'm no fool! Both of you worship [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]!

column2: It has been many months since peasants and courtiers alike began to call for a hunt for cultists. Despite their best efforts to point fingers you have found no one you believe to be a real follower of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. They have now given up hope of you ever finding the guilty infidels.
I pray it will be over now.
